news_items.content: Here's the rewritten news in a clearer and more concise manner:
* The GCC (Gulf Cooperation Council) is set to launch a mass vaccination drive for stray dogs in July.
* Polytechnic students in Tamil Nadu are being offered on-the-job training.
Kanyakumari (Tamil Nadu) - A strong dust storm has hit Delhi, adjoining areas, and the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert.
* The MP son and brother of TN minister K N Nehru have been accused of diverting funds from a â‚¹30 crore bank loan.
* A fire broke out in Chromepet, causing chaos on the EMU train.
Karachi (Pakistan) - Pakistani military officials attended funerals of terrorists killed in an Indian strike.
* The Indian Navy was prepared to strike Karachi if Pakistan continued to support terrorism.
Hyderabad (India) - Protests are ongoing as protesters demand a name change for the city's bakery, which is being vandalized by Karachi Bakery owners.
* "I'm not going to give away my land," said CM Mann. "If you want it, you can buy it."
California (USA) - Zuckerberg has announced his vision for AI development, stating that most of one's friends will be AI in the future.
Elon Musk (Canada) - Apple is developing custom chips for smart glasses and other products.
* The European Union agency warns that AI is being used to commit crimes such as drug trafficking, people smuggling, and money laundering.
Arizona (USA) - A man shot and killed his killer by returning to address him.
